en.title: Ansible – Lesson 2: Architecture & Working
en.subtitle: Understanding Control Node, Managed Node, Inventory, SSH and Working Flow

sections.heading: 1. Ansible Architecture Overview
sections.content: Ansible follows a simple client-server architecture where one system controls multiple target systems using SSH.

sections.heading: 2. What is Control Node?
sections.content: The Control Node is the machine where Ansible is installed. It is used to run playbooks and send commands to other servers.

sections.heading: 3. What are Managed Nodes?
sections.content: Managed Nodes are the target servers that Ansible manages. These servers do not need Ansible installed on them.

sections.heading: 4. What is Inventory?
sections.content: Inventory is a file where the list of all managed nodes (IP address or hostnames) is stored. It tells Ansible which servers to manage.

sections.heading: 5. Static and Dynamic Inventory
sections.content: Static inventory is a simple text file. Dynamic inventory is generated automatically from cloud providers like AWS and Azure.

sections.heading: 6. What is SSH in Ansible?
sections.content: Ansible uses SSH to connect from control node to managed nodes securely without installing an agent.

sections.heading: 7. Agentless Architecture
sections.content: Ansible is agentless, which means no software needs to be installed on managed nodes. Only SSH access is required.

sections.heading: 8. How Ansible Works (Working Flow)
sections.content: User writes a playbook → Ansible reads the inventory → Connects to nodes via SSH → Executes tasks → Returns output.

sections.heading: 9. Push Based Model
sections.content: Ansible follows a push-based model where the control node pushes configurations to target servers.

sections.heading: 10. Ports Used by Ansible
sections.content: Ansible mainly uses port 22 for SSH. For Windows, it uses WinRM on ports 5985 and 5986.

sections.heading: 11. Real-Time Example
sections.content: If you want to install nginx on 10 servers, you write one playbook and Ansible installs it on all servers at the same time.

sections.heading: Lesson 2 Summary
sections.content: You learned Ansible architecture, control node, managed node, inventory, SSH and working flow.

ta.title: Ansible – பாடம் 2: Architecture & Working
ta.subtitle: Control Node, Managed Node, Inventory, SSH மற்றும் Working Flow விளக்கம்

sections.heading: 1. Ansible Architecture Overview
sections.content: Ansible ஒரு simple client-server architecture-ஐ பயன்படுத்துகிறது.

sections.heading: 2. Control Node என்றால் என்ன?
sections.content: Ansible install செய்யப்பட்ட machine தான் Control Node. இதிலிருந்து playbooks run செய்யப்படும்.

sections.heading: 3. Managed Nodes என்றால் என்ன?
sections.content: Ansible manage செய்யப்படும் target servers தான் Managed Nodes.

sections.heading: 4. Inventory என்றால் என்ன?
sections.content: Inventory file-ல் எல்லா target servers-ன் IP address அல்லது hostname இருக்கும்.

sections.heading: 5. Static & Dynamic Inventory
sections.content: Static inventory text file. Dynamic inventory cloud-ல இருந்து auto generate ஆகும்.

sections.heading: 6. SSH in Ansible
sections.content: Control node-லிருந்து managed nodes-க்கு SSH மூலமாக connection உண்டாகும்.

sections.heading: 7. Agentless Architecture
sections.content: Managed nodes-ல் Ansible install செய்ய தேவையில்லை.

sections.heading: 8. Ansible எப்படி வேலை செய்கிறது?
sections.content: Playbook எழுதுதல் → Inventory வாசித்தல் → SSH மூலம் server-க்கு connect ஆகுதல் → Task run ஆகுதல்.

sections.heading: 9. Push Based Model
sections.content: Control node-லிருந்து servers-க்கு configuration push செய்யப்படும்.

sections.heading: 10. பயன்படுத்தப்படும் Ports
sections.content: Linux-க்கு port 22, Windows-க்கு 5985, 5986 ports பயன்படுத்தப்படுகிறது.

sections.heading: 11. Real Example
sections.content: ஒரே playbook கொண்டு 10 servers-ல் nginx install செய்யலாம்.

sections.heading: Lesson 2 Summary
sections.content: Ansible architecture மற்றும் working flow பற்றி நீங்கள் கற்றுக்கொண்டீர்கள்.
